snippet: Gilberto Valle, 28, could receive life in prison for one count of kidnapping conspiracy when he is sentenced on June 19; he was fired from the Police Department upon conviction.
abstract: New York City Police Officer Gilberto Valle is convicted in plot to kidnap, torture, kill and eat women, ending trial whose outcome hinged on delicate distinction between fantasy and reality; he could receive life in prison for one count of kidnapping conspiracy when he is sentenced on June 19; he is fired from Police Department upon conviction.

byline.contributor: Daniel Krieger and Jack Styczynski contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gilberto Valle, 28, could receive life in prison for one count of kidnapping conspiracy when he is sentenced on June 19; he was fired from the Police Department upon conviction.

headline.seo: Officer Is Found Guilty in Cannibal Plot
headline.main: ‘Ugly Thoughts’ Defense Fails as Officer Is Convicted in Cannibal Plot
headline.print_headline: ‘Ugly Thoughts’ Defense Fails; Officer Guilty in Cannibal Plot
